messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `UserController` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/users`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `UserController`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php:12:class UserController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the handler implementations used by routes/admin.php:

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php

Explanation:
- routes/admin.php imports App\Http\Controllers\Admin\UserController and registers a resource route for 'users' (only index, edit, update).
- I searched the project for "class UserController" and found three controllers with that class name; the one used by the admin routes is the Admin namespace controller at app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php.
- I inspected that file and it implements the index(), edit(User $user) and update(UsersRequest $request, User $user) methods referenced by the routes. Other UserController files (e.g., app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php and app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php) exist but are in different namespaces and are not the controller imported by routes/admin.php.
